availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Mack (16th US Infantry, private and sergeant)

body.p: United States, soldier. Native of Ireland. Served in the 16th U.S. Infantry Regiment as a private and sergeant from October 15, 1863 to October 15, 1868.

ab.bibl:
Eleventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1890), Veterans Schedules, Massachusetts, Middlesex County, Watertown, p. 1.
"Capt. J. B. Mack Dead," The Boston Globe (Boston, Massachusetts), February 3, 1906, p. 11.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application 844329, Certificate 626531.
KYR-0001-003-0051
